materials needed **size h 5mm crochet hook** **yarn** in the same color as your cozy for trimming and the main project **tapestry needle** for light sewing and weaving in ends **scissors** embellishments such as buttons and other decorative items # finish the mug cozy pattern and move on to the sleeves ## round 1 create a slip knot on your hook begin with the trim color and chain 8 starting in the second chain from the hook do not count the loop on the hook work **1 single crochet** into each stitch down the row total of 7 stitches fasten_off and tie on the main color yarn ## round 2 chain 1 and work 1 single_crochet into the same stitch continue by working 1 single_crochet into each stitch across the row ## round 3 repeat round chain 1 and turn your work perform 1 single_crochet into each stitch down the row total of 7 repeat this round 5 times final touches and finishing the mug sweater begin by folding the sleeve in half and using your crochet hook to slip_stitch down the side to close it fasten_off leaving a long tail for sewing onto the cozy approximately 12 inches repeat this process to create a second sleeve ## sewing the sleeves onto the cozy flatten the sleeve so that the seam is positioned downward against the cozy take a tapestry needle and thread it with the long tail secure the sleeve by weaving the needle in and out several times through both the sleeve and the cozy don t forget to secure the tops of the sleeves as well finally fasten_off and weave in any excess tail ## add embellishments optional get creative by incorporating a range of fun items to decorate your sweater consider using buttons pom poms sequins ribbons felt and more whenever possible sew these embellishments on or opt for a heat-resistant glue enjoy the process and have a blast basic crochet coaster pattern this cozy features a sturdy granny square design complemented by a single_crochet border ## materials required size h 5mm crochet hook size 4 worsted weight yarn acrylic or cotton in two colors tapestry needle for weaving in ends scissors the pattern suggests using two colors however you can choose to use just one if you prefer furthermore incorporating a single_crochet border is optional # round 1 starting with the main color chain 4 then slip_stitch into the first chain to create a ring chain 3 this counts as a double_crochet work 1 double_crochet into the ring *chain 2 then work 3 double crochets into the ring * repeat from the * two more times chain 2 and work
